key_points: Buckingham Palace confirmed Prince Harry and Meghan will not return to royal duties.
Harry will relinquish his honorary military titles.
The decision finalizes the couple's separation from royal family duties.
The review of their roles was conducted a year after they stepped away in March 2020.
Queen Elizabeth II and Harry discussed the impossibility of continuing with public service responsibilities.
Meghan will lose her patronages, including with Britain's National Theatre and the Association of Commonwealth Universities.
Harry and Meghan remain much-loved members of the family despite their decision.
The couple moved to North America, citing media intrusions and racist attitudes.
They retain their Duke and Duchess titles but no longer use 'royal highness' or receive public funds for royal duties.
The couple's spokesperson emphasized their ongoing commitment to duty and service.
